MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.App.Usage.NetworkStats? QueryDetails (Android.Net.ConnectivityType networkType, string? subscriberId, long startTime, long endTime);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.App.Usage.NetworkStats QueryDetails(valuetype Android.Net.ConnectivityType networkType, string subscriberId, int64 startTime, int64 endTime) cil managed

abstract member QueryDetails : Android.Net.ConnectivityType * string * int64 * int64 -> Android.App.Usage.NetworkStats override this.QueryDetails : Android.Net.ConnectivityType * string * int64 * int64 -> Android.App.Usage.NetworkStats

Docs.param: As defined in ConnectivityManager, e.g. ConnectivityManager#TYPE_MOBILE, ConnectivityManager#TYPE_WIFI etc.

If applicable, the subscriber id of the network interface.

Starting with API level 29, the subscriberId is guarded by additional restrictions. Calling apps that do not meet the new requirements to access the subscriberId can provide a null value when querying for the mobile network type to receive usage for all mobile networks. For additional details see TelephonyManager#getSubscriberId().

Starting with API level 31, calling apps can provide a subscriberId with wifi network type to receive usage for wifi networks which is under the given subscription if applicable. Otherwise, pass null when querying all wifi networks.
Start of period. Defined in terms of "Unix time", see java.lang.System#currentTimeMillis.
End of period. Defined in terms of "Unix time", see java.lang.System#currentTimeMillis.
Docs.returns: Statistics object or null if permissions are insufficient or error happened during statistics collection.

format.a: Java documentation for android.app.usage.NetworkStatsManager.queryDetails(int, java.lang.String, long, long).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.App.Usage.NetworkStats? QueryDetailsForUidTagState (Android.Net.ConnectivityType networkType, string? subscriberId, long startTime, long endTime, int uid, int tag, Android.App.Usage.NetworkUsageState state);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.App.Usage.NetworkStats QueryDetailsForUidTagState(valuetype Android.Net.ConnectivityType networkType, string subscriberId, int64 startTime, int64 endTime, int32 uid, int32 tag, valuetype Android.App.Usage.NetworkUsageState state) cil managed

MemberSignature.Usage: networkStatsManager.QueryDetailsForUidTagState (networkType, subscriberId, startTime, endTime, uid, tag, state)

Docs.param: As defined in ConnectivityManager, e.g. ConnectivityManager#TYPE_MOBILE, ConnectivityManager#TYPE_WIFI etc.

If applicable, the subscriber id of the network interface.

Starting with API level 29, the subscriberId is guarded by additional restrictions. Calling apps that do not meet the new requirements to access the subscriberId can provide a null value when querying for the mobile network type to receive usage for all mobile networks. For additional details see TelephonyManager#getSubscriberId().

Starting with API level 31, calling apps can provide a subscriberId with wifi network type to receive usage for wifi networks which is under the given subscription if applicable. Otherwise, pass null when querying all wifi networks.
Start of period. Defined in terms of "Unix time", see java.lang.System#currentTimeMillis.
End of period. Defined in terms of "Unix time", see java.lang.System#currentTimeMillis.
TAG of interest. Use NetworkStats.Bucket#TAG_NONE for no tags.
state of interest. Use NetworkStats.Bucket#STATE_ALL to aggregate traffic from all states.
Docs.summary: Query network usage statistics details for a given uid, tag, and state.
Docs.returns: Statistics object or null if an error happened during statistics collection.

format.a: Java documentation for android.app.usage.NetworkStatsManager.queryDetailsForUidTagState(int, java.lang.String, long, long, int, int, int).
